intro: Mapouria subspathulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mapouria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
